doc.name: submit-beforecallback
doc.description: This will trigger a JavaScript function when someone submits a form, but before the actual form is submitted.
doc.note:
If you also have a callback function defined you can use them both. Your beforecallback function will receive the submit button and the name of the callback function. A beforecallback function will hold the submit operation. If beforecallback function is ready and you want the form to continue submitting you will have to end your function with : wsform( btn, callback );

Example :

function myBeforeCallBack( btn, callback ) {
   alert("callback before posting");
   wsform( btn, callback );
}

This JavaScript will not be loaded in the same way as the callback JavaScript is. Usually when you have a beforecallback function you will have a callback function. Have your beforecallback function be in the callback JavaScript. If you do not have a callback JavaScript you can define your function in the Common.js.
